alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 12:24PM PDT until April 05 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR THE SOUTH WASHINGTON CASCADES ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches near 4000 feet with 16 to 32 inches above 5000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph with even stronger winds expected above treeline, resulting in blowing snow. * WHERE...Above 3500 feet in the South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Be prepared for difficult winter travel conditions and any attendant travel restrictions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect near whiteout conditions above treeline in the Cascades Sunday night into Monday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
